name: Fractured Literary Quotations Quiz | Fractured Books | 10 Questions

questions.text: Day Oslo swerve coo lonely stunned on weight.
questions.correct: They also serve who only stand and wait
questions.explanation:
They also serve who only stand and wait.

	By John Milton.

questions.correct: Oh Death where is thy sting & O Death where is thy sting
questions.explanation:
Oh Death where is thy sting & O Death where is thy sting.

	From Corinthians I, Chapter 15, verse 55. The verse continues: "O Grave, where is thy victory?"

All the worlds a stage.

	By William Shakespeare.

questions.text: Shell icon party tour simmers Dei?
questions.correct: Shall I compare thee to a summers day
questions.explanation:
Shall I compare thee to a summers day.

	By William Shakespeare. The second line goes: "Thou art more lovely and more temperate." BTW: "Dei" means "God" in Latin.

questions.text: Bud salved, wad lied true yawn Darwin dough brakes?
questions.correct: But soft what light through yonder window breaks
questions.explanation:
But soft what light through yonder window breaks.

	Romeo's line from Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet." He's watching her bedroom window from down below.

questions.text: Howl dewy loaf see? Lemming county vase.
questions.correct: How do I love thee Let me count the ways
questions.explanation:
How do I love thee Let me count the ways.

	By Elizabeth Barrett Browning.

questions.text: Due rose die virgin Aiello would.
questions.correct: Two roads diverged in a yellow wood
questions.explanation:
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood.

	From "The Road Not Taken" by Robert Frost. Actor Danny Aiello is perhaps best known for playing Cher's fiance (and her lover's older brother) in "Moonstruck."

questions.text: Doughnut goo Gentile undo sat goon eye.
questions.correct: Do not go gentle into that goodnight & Do not go gentle into that good night
questions.explanation:
Do not go gentle into that goodnight & Do not go gentle into that good night.

	By Dylan Thomas.

questions.text: Heifer leek, hovel leak, Hoffa leaf fawn weird!
questions.correct: Half a league half a league half a league onward
questions.explanation:
Half a league half a league half a league onward.

	From "The Charge of the Light Brigade" by Alfred Lord Tennyson. The next part goes: "All in the Valley of Death rode the six hundred."

Parting is such sweet sorrow.

	Also from Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet." The line continues: "...that I shall say good-night till it be morrow."
